name: Lead Section Summary
description: Summarize the person's life and works in a balanced manner, ensuring that controversial information does not overshadow their overall contributions. The summary must reflect the content of the entire article neutrally.

name: Historical Perspective on Recent Events
description: When discussing notable recent events, provide perspective by balancing this information with relevant historical context, giving appropriate weight to both recent and long-standing details.

name: Death Information in the Lead
description: If the subject has passed away, include a concise death date or a single sentence about the death in the lead without significantly altering the overall structure, unless it is critical for notability.

name: Content of the Opening Paragraph
description: Craft the opening paragraph to neutrally introduce the individual, providing essential context and establishing their notability without excessive detail overcrowding the first sentence.

name: First Sentence Requirements
description: The first sentence must include the person's full name, birth and death dates (if applicable), relevant context, and key reasons for notability, presented succinctly.

name: Birth Date and Place Format
description: Format birth and death dates as day-month-year when relevant. Location details should be included in the body of the article rather than in the lead.

name: Contextual Clarity
description: The lead paragraph should clarify the context of the individual's notability, focusing on relevant contemporary or historical factors without unnecessary emphasis on ethnicity or previous nationalities.

name: Describing Positions and Roles
description: Clearly state the person's noteworthy positions and roles in the lead, ensuring the introduction remains focused and free of incidental information.

name: Handling Criminal Acts
description: Avoid using criminal terms in the first sentence; instead, describe the specifics of the crime, especially when it relates directly to the person's notability.

name: Proper Name Usage
description: Utilize the most widely recognized form of the person's name at the start of the article, following naming conventions for clarity and disambiguation.

name: Text Formatting for Names
description: Adhere to English formatting standards for personal names, steering clear of unusual capitalization and letter substitutions, and only bold nicknames when appropriate.

name: Initial Mention of Full Name
description: State the full name of the individual in the lead sentence at the first mention to maintain a balance between information and readability.

name: Alternative Names in the Lead
description: Include alternative names or nicknames in the lead only if they are frequently cited by reliable sources, avoiding an excess of uncommon or irrelevant alternatives.

name: Anachronistic Naming
description: Apply names appropriate to the subject's time period when making historical references and avoid using anachronistic terms in biographies.

name: Changed Names Consideration
description: Mention birth names when significant and include details about any legal name changes, considering privacy concerns for living individuals.

name: Names with Suffixes
description: Use generational or regnal suffixes only when they appear commonly in reliable sources, ensuring no unnecessary punctuation precedes them.

name: Subsequent Use Reference
description: After the initial mention, refer to the individual by surname only, and avoid using honorifics or titles unless they are standard usage in reliable sources.

name: Tense Usage
description: Use present tense for living individuals and past tense for those who have passed away, maintaining consistent tense usage throughout the biography.

name: Out-of-date Material
description: Refrain from including time-sensitive statements to ensure the biography remains accurate and current, employing templates for references to ongoing events.

name: Chronological Order
description: Structure the biography chronologically, detailing events from birth to death in sequential sections as applicable.

name: Handling of Sexuality
description: Do not overemphasize the individual's sexuality in the lead unless it has direct relevance to their notability.

name: Gender Identity and Deadnaming
description: Utilize names and pronouns that reflect the individual's most recent self-identification and avoid mentioning deadnames unless the person is notable under that name.

name: Authority Control Placement
description: Position authority control identifiers at the end of biographical articles, above the default sort, to link associated data.
